standard_metadata.standard_description: Measure volumes by counting unit cubes, using cubic cm, cubic in, cubic ft, and improvised units.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Volume of rectangular prisms with unit cubes

question.content: Unit cube:     **What is the volume of the rectangular prism?**   *Some of the cubes might be hidden behind other cubes. Try to visualize all of the cubes.*     cubic units

images.alt: A cube has a visible front, right hand side, and top faces.

The front face of the rectangular prism has 6 cubes: 3 rows, 2 columns. The top face of the rectangular prism has 8 cubes: 4 rows, 2 columns. The right-hand side face of the rectangular prism has 12 cubes: 3 rows, 4 columns.

hints.content: Volume is measured by counting the number of cubic units.
So, we can count the number of unit cubes.

We can also look at the layers.  We can count $\greenD8$ cubes on each layer of the prism.   There are $\blueD3$ layers, so we can find the total number of cubes by multiplying.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD8\times \blueD3= \Box$

images.alt: A rectangular prism shown in two parts: The top layer is shown separately from the 2 bottom layers. The front face of the top layer has 2 cubes: 1 row, 2 columns. The top face of the top layer has 8 cubes: 4 rows, 2 columns. The right-hand side face of the top layer has 4 cubes: 1 row, 4 columns. The front face of the 2 bottom layers has 4 cubes: 2 rows, 2 columns. The top face of the 2 bottom layers has 8 cubes: 4 rows, 2 columns. The right-hand side face of the 2 bottom layers has 8 cubes: 2 rows, 4 columns.

hints.content: The volume of the prism is $24$ cubic units.

The right-hand side face of the 2 bottom layers has 4 cubes: 2 rows, 2 columns.

hints.content: The volume of the prism is $18$ cubic units.
